trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of regional anaesthesia with supraclavicular brachial plexus block on the vessels of the upper arm operated for vascular access
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of supraclavicular brachial plexus block on the regional hemodynamics of the upper arm in patients operated for vascular access

conditions.healthcondition: regional hemodynamics of the upper limb after supraclavicular brachial plexus block

interventions.interventions:
1. No pre-medication
2. Standard monitoring: ECG, non invasive blood pressure, oxymetry.
3. Peripheral venous cannulation
4. Ultrasound guided supraclavicular block using 15 ml lidocaine 2% + 15 ml bupivacaine 0.5%
The duration of each procedure is approximately 15 minutes

primaryOutcome.outcome: brachial artery blood flow measured with ultrasound-doppler at mid arm
primaryOutcome.timepoint: T0: before performing the block T15: 15 minutes after the procedure is completed T30: 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

primaryOutcome.outcome: cephalic vein diameter measured with ultrasound at mid arm
primaryOutcome.timepoint: T0: before performing the block T15: 15 minutes after the procedure is completed T30: 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

primaryOutcome.outcome: brachial artery pulsatility and resistivity indexes measured with ultrasound-doppler at mid arm
primaryOutcome.timepoint: T0: before performing the block T15: 15 minutes after the procedure is completed T30: 30 minutes after the procedure is completed

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Success rate for surgical anaesthesia : seccess is defined by the absence of pain at skin incision
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 40 minutes, after the procedure is completed

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients requiring hemodialysis and scheuled to elective confection of humeral-cephalic arteriovenous fistula under regional anaesthesia
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Patient refusal 2. Allergy to local anesthetics 3. Existing neurological disorders, neuropathy of the operative extremity 4. Infection at site of needle puncture 5. Coagulation disorders

trial_design.concealment: Subjects for the study will be recruited from the operating list

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Perpheral nerve blocks are known to induce many changes in the local circulation such as vasodilation. We use the ultrasound-doppler to show and quantify the variations of the regional hemodynamics of the upper arm after a supraclavicular brachial plexus block.
